item.title: Mastering Nmap for Real-World Network Scanning
item.description: A deep dive into mastering Nmap for real-world network scanning with full command outputs, analysis, use cases, and expert tips. Learn how to use Nmap for auditing your local network like a pro.

item.title: üß™ Setting Up a Penetration Testing Lab using VirtualBox + Kali Linux
item.description: Build your own penetration testing lab using VirtualBox, Kali Linux, and Metasploitable 2. Step-by-step tutorial with commands, diagrams, network isolation tips, and expert practices.

item.title: üîç Recon-ng Mastery: Complete OSINT Framework Guide (Beginner to Expert)
item.description:
üöÄ Learn how to use Recon-ng from scratch to expert level with real-world examples, commands, API tips, and professional automation workflows.

üß† What is Recon-ng?

Recon-ng is an open-source OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) framework written in Python that helps security researchers, red teamers, and bug bounty hunters automate reconnaissance tasks.

It mimics the Metasploit interface, offering powerful modules to collect intel like domains, hosts, credentials, social profiles, leaked data, and more ‚Äî all in an automated, database-backed workspace.

item.title: Mastering Ping: The Network Reconnaissance Swiss Army Knife
item.description:
The ping command is the most fundamental yet powerful network diagnostic tool in any cybersecurity professional’s arsenal. this deceptively simple tool can reveal critical network intelligence when used with advanced techniques.

üîç What is Ping?

Ping (Packet Internet Groper) uses ICMP Echo Requests to:

  • Verify host availability
  • Measure network latency
  • Detect packet loss
  • Map network paths
  • Identify firewall configurations

‚ÑπÔ∏è Protocol Note: Ping operates at Layer 3 (Network Layer) using ICMP protocol, making it independent of higher-layer services.

item.title: üîç Mastering Photon: The Ultimate Web Scraping & OSINT Tool for Ethical Hackers
item.description:
üåê What is Photon?

Photon is a lightning-fast, smart web crawler built specifically for OSINT tasks. It‚Äôs not just a URL scraper‚Äîit‚Äôs a powerful weapon for bug bounty hunters, ethical hackers, and red teamers to extract:

  • ‚úÖ Emails & social links
  • ‚úÖ Endpoints & APIs
  • ‚úÖ JS files & secrets
  • ‚úÖ Hidden files (PDFs, ZIPs)
  • ‚úÖ Wayback Machine archives

‚ö†Ô∏è Note: Use Photon only on websites you own or have explicit permission to test. Unauthorized scans may violate cyber laws like CFAA.

item.title: üîç YouTube OSINT: Extract Hidden Intel from Public Videos
item.description:
üåê Why YouTube is an OSINT Goldmine

YouTube videos often leak valuable data without organizations realizing it. By analyzing videos carefully, you can extract:

  • üßë Employee identities (via intros or ID cards)
  • üñ•Ô∏è Internal systems or credentials visible on screens
  • üåç Location data (GPS tags or visible environments)
  • üóÇÔ∏è Metadata (upload date, location, camera info)
  • üìΩÔ∏è Deleted or private content (recovered via thumbnails or third-party sources)

‚ö†Ô∏è Disclaimer: This blog is for educational and ethical hacking purposes only. Always ensure you have permission when conducting OSINT investigations.

item.title: Advanced Google Dorking for Target Reconnaissance
item.description:
Google Dorking (also known as Google Hacking) is a powerful method used in Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) to extract sensitive information from search engines using advanced search operators. As cybersecurity enthusiasts, especially in the RajkumaR CyberSec Blog, we explore how attackers and ethical hackers utilize these dorks in real-world reconnaissance.

üîç What is Google Dorking?

Google Dorking involves using advanced search operators to uncover exposed files, login panels, debug pages, and misconfigured servers. It helps penetration testers, bug bounty hunters, and red teamers gather actionable intelligence.
